thread.title: 9 best things to do in N.J. this weekend
thread.title_full: 9 best things to do in N.J. this weekend | NJ.com

author: Bill Bodkin | For NJ Advance Media
title: 9 best things to do in N.J. this weekend
text:
NEW JERSEY ZOMBIE WALK
Rescheduled from last weekend. The resurrected New Jersey Zombie Walk will return to Asbury Park this Saturday. After being put to rest only a few months ago, local bar owner John "Johnny Mac" McGillion has teamed with the original founders of the walk to keep this Jersey Shore institution going. 'Walkers' can register and prepare their costumes from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. in front of the old carousel building on the boardwalk. The walk begins at 4 p.m. From 6 p.m. to 8 p.m. a DJ will be spinning at the end of the walk in Merchant's Park. The official afterparty will take place at Johnny Mac's House of Spirits on Main Street. Free. Saturday, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. (Registration); 4 p.m. kick-off; Asbury Park Boardwalk.
JUST JERSEY FOOD TRUCK & MUSIC FESTIVAL
Rescheduled from last weekend. The final installment of the Just Jersey Food Truck and Music Festival will take place Saturday at Waterloo Village in Stanhope. There will be more than 25 gourmet food trucks on hand, and the festival is taking donations of non-perishable food items for the Food Bank of Roxbury Township. As with many food truck fests, craft beer will also be on tap, including selections from Forgotten Boardwalk and Ommegang . The soundtrack for the fest will be provided by The Sam Haiman Band, Men of Horses, Laura Marsh, and longtime Jersey cover band, Milo Z. $5 (Kids under 12 free); Saturday 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; 1053 Waterloo Road, Stanhope.
Saturday, October 10 at 10:00 AM Just Jersey Food Truck and Music Festival Waterloo Village SEE FULL EVENT DETAILS nj.com THE RACE OF GENTLEMEN
Rescheduled from last weekend. If you love embracing traditions from a bygone era — or if you just love admiring classic vehicle — The Race of Gentlemen is for you. Races will take place on Saturday and Sunday, featuring beautiful vintage cars and motorcycles pitted against each other on the beaches of Wildwood; it's truly a site to be seen. There will be live music throughout the weekend, and we recommend you check out a set from surf rock trio, Black Flamingos . If you make it down to Wildwood Friday, there's a number of pre-gaming events, ranging from parties to classic motorcycle exhibitions. Weekend passes are $50; Saturday and Sunday, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m; Beachfront, Wildwood.
SEASIDE OFF-ROAD AND TRUCK SHOW
Rescheduled from last weekend. Trucks, hot wings, the beach, beer, and huge slices of pizza. Sounds more like summer than October. The Seaside Off-Road and Truck Show is a truck lovers' dream. This outdoor/beachfront show features a vast array of wildly tricked out, custom-built, and unique trucks and off-road vehicles. The event begins Friday night at 8 p.m. with a special truck meet at the show site (the parking lot next to the Sawmill Cafe ), presented by Globex Performance . Inside the Sawmill there will be entertainment, as well as food and drink specials. On Saturday, attendees can gaze upon the trucks, play volleyball, enter a hot wing eating contest, rent buggies for the beach or take part in other contests. Free (except for truck registrants); Friday - 8 p.m., Saturday 8 a.m.-11 a.m. (truck registration), trucks are allowed to leave at 5 p.m.; 1800 Ocean Avenue, Seaside Park.
The Seaside Off-Road and Truck Show takes place this Saturday in Seaside Park, right outside the Sawmill Cafe. Photo Courtesy Bring Em Out Promotions SOUTH JERSEY PUMPKIN SHOW
Tis the season for all things pumpkin, so why not celebrate at 12th annual South Jersey Pumpkin Show ? Friday to Sunday there will be live music, haunted hayrides, food trucks, pony rides, a massive pumpkin pie display, and an appearance by the Headless Horseman. There will also be plenty of things for the little ones, like the Little Miss & Mister Pageant, a costume parade, and "Come Paint with Me" classes. Free; Friday 5 to 9 p.m., Saturday 10 a.m. to 7 p.m., Sunday 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Salem County Fairgrounds , 735 Harding Hwy, Woodstown.
Friday, October 9 at 4:00 PM South Jersey Pumpkin Show Festival Salem County Fair Grounds SEE FULL EVENT DETAILS nj.com VOLCOM TO SCREEN NEW SURF MOVIE AT PARAMOUNT THEATER
The Paramount Theater in Asbury Park is a gorgeous venue to take in a film. The rich architectural designs, the sound quality — it's all primed for a memorable cinematic experience. This Friday, " Psychic Migrations ," the latest surf movie from clothing giant Volcom, will make it's New Jersey premiere. The film, directed by veteran surf filmmaker Ryan Thomas, follows renowned surfers Kelly Slater, Dusty Payne, Ozzie Wright, Yago Dora, and others, as they surf the West and East Indies, Indies, Australia, Polynesia, and the Americas. "The film weaves the physical expression of riding a rousing score of waves with a cerebral odyssey through the scapes and textures travelled to find them." Free; Friday, 7 p.m.; 1300 Ocean Avenue, Asbury Park.
Volcom's latest surf film Psychic Migrations will be screened at The Paramount Theater in Asbury Park on Friday. Photo Courtesy of Volcom. CENTRAL JERSEY BEER FESTIVAL
Beer lovers owe a little bit of thanks to the people over at Blend Bar & Bistro in Hamilton Square. The bar will be celebrating their anniversary by curating the Central Jersey Beer Festival at the Mercer County Fairgrounds Saturday. The festival will feature more than 50 craft breweries including: Blue Point, Carton, Demented, Rinn Duin, Founders, Southern Tier, Goose Island, Tuckahoe, and Tröegs. Tickets for the fest include beer, live music, and plastic commemorative tasting glass. If you're one of the first 500 people to buy a ticket, you'll receive a glass tasting cup. Part of the proceeds of this event will benefit Men & Women's Health via the Princeton YWCA Breast Cancer Resource Center & Movember Foundation USA. Tickets are $65, available here. Saturday, 12 to 6 p.m.; Mercer County Fairgrounds, 1665 Mercerville- Edinburg Rd, West Windsor.
Saturday, October 10 at 12:00 PM Central Jersey Beer Festival Mercer County Park SEE FULL EVENT DETAILS nj.com ATLANTIC CITY COMEDY FESTIVAL
The sixth annual Atlantic City Comedy Festival will be splitting sides on Saturday and Sunday at Boardwalk Hall. The lineup for the weekend includes such TV, film and stand-up veterans as John Witherspoon ("Friday," "The Wayans Brothers"), Tommy Davidson ("In Living Color"), Earthquake, Bruce Bruce, Sommore, and Mike Epps ("Next Friday," "Survivor's Remorse). Tickets range from $48.50-$79; Saturday and Sunday. 2304 Boardwalk, Atlantic City.
TALL GIRLS EAST COAST PREMIERE
The Dust Bowl of the 1930s comes to the Luna Stage in West Orange of 2015. "Tall Girls," a new play written by Meg Miroshnik and directed by Jane Mandel, is making its East Coast debut this weekend. The show will run at the Luna until Nov. 1. The play, inspired by the "flourishing and decline" of girls' basketball in high schools in 1930s rural Midwest, revolves around a mysterious man who takes up a job teaching at a local school. The show "explores class, gender, and the history of women in sports, and asks just who can afford the luxury of play." Tickets range from $22 to $37; Shows are Thursday to Sunday until Nov. 1.; 555 Valley Road, West Orange, 973-395-5551.
Friday, October 9 at 8:00 PM "The Tall Girls" Luna Stage SEE FULL EVENT DETAILS nj.com Bill Bodkin can be reached at bodkinwrites@gmail.com . Find NJ.com/Entertainment on Facebook .
